description: Computes anomalies based on normals for temporal periods.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description:
A data cube with exactly one temporal dimension and the following dimension labels for the given period (`YYYY` = four-digit year, `MM` = two-digit month, `DD` two-digit day of month):

* `hour`: `YYYY-MM-DD-00` - `YYYY-MM-DD-23`
* `day`: `YYYY-001` - `YYYY-365`
* `week`: `YYYY-01` - `YYYY-52`
* `month`: `YYYY-1` - `YYYY-12`
* `year`: `YYYY`
* `decade`: `YYY0` (first year of the decade)
* `single_period` / `climatology_period`: A single dimension label with any name is expected.
* `season`: `YYYY-djf` (December - February), `YYYY-mam` (March - May), `YYYY-jja` (June - August), `YYYY-son` (September - November)
* `tropical_season`: `YYYY-ndjfma` (November - April), `YYYY-mjjaso` (May - October)

``aggregate_temporal_period()`` can compute such a data cube.

parameters.name: normals
parameters.description:
A data cube with normals, e.g. daily, monthly or yearly values computed from a process such as ``climatological_normal()``. Must contain exactly one temporal dimension with the following dimension labels for the given period:

* `hour`: `00` - `23`
* `day`: `001` - `365`
* `week`: `01` - `52`
* `month`: `01` - `12`
* `year`: Four-digit year numbers
* `decade`: Four-digit year number for the first year of each decade.
* `single_period` / `climatology_period`: A single dimension label with any name is expected.
* `season`: `djf` (December - February), `mam` (March - May), `jja` (June - August), `son` (September - November)
* `tropical_season`: `ndjfma` (November - April), `mjjaso` (May - October)

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
Specifies the time intervals available in the normals data cube. The following options are available:

* `hour`: Hour of the day
* `day`: Day of the year
* `week`: Week of the year
* `month`: Month of the year
* `year`: Proleptic years
* `decade`: 10 year period, starting from years ending in a 0 to years ending in a 9 (e.g. 1990 - 1999).
* `season`: Refers to three month periods of the calendar seasons (December - February, March - May, June - August, September - November).
* `tropical_season`: Refers to the six month periods of the tropical seasons (November - April, May - October).

returns.description: A data cube. The cardinality, resolution, the number of dimensions and the dimension labels are the same as for the original data cube.
